column4: i just installed 9.04 from 8.04.2 and kept my /home partition.  i changed my user name, so i was wondering if there was an easy way to just copy everything from my previous user folder to my new one
can i just rename the folder?
can i do it as root?
i mean, its just a directory, right
I dont know if I'm missing something those other people are saying will mess up but should be no problem to copy home over as root and then chown it to your new username
I've copied over home many times before
it's not just the /home, but from two different usernames
might want to just back up both directories anyway
i don't belive in back ups!
then you shouldnt be doing things like this
I dont think thats the mission statement for ubuntu at all, probably something like the opposite.
